definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Their intrusion into our private lives is unwarrantable .
sentences.chinese: 他们侵扰我们的私生活是毫无道理的。

sentences.english: Some journalists like to colour their stories up with lurid detailsof people's private lives.
sentences.chinese: 有些记者喜欢渲染人们私生活的一些俗艳故事细节。

sentences.english: The scandal about his private life stalked the firm soon.
sentences.chinese: 有关他私生活的丑闻迅速在公司里传播开了。

sentences.english: Someone is spreading mischievous stories about minister's private life.
sentences.chinese: 有关部长个人私生活的流言晦语正在传播。

sentences.english: I recognise my own shortcomings, the faults in the conduct of my private life.
sentences.chinese: 我发现了自己的缺点，我的私生活中有大量错误。

sentences.english: I'm never interested in nosing out the details of someone else's private life.
sentences.chinese: 我从不喜欢探听别人私生活的细节。

sentences.english: Don't pry into private life of others.
sentences.chinese: 不要窥探别人的私生活。

sentences.english: Yeah. It's almost as if Air Barbados doesn't care about your social life.
sentences.chinese: 就是说，巴贝多航空真是不关心你的私生活。

sentences.english: Should Newsmen's Private Life Be Treated as News?
sentences.chinese: 可否将新闻记者的私生活当作新闻？

sentences.english: Touch on anything in his personal life and you'll be stonewalled.
sentences.chinese: 一旦触及任何关于他私生活的事，你就得小心了。

sentences.english: The film star evaded questions about her private life.
sentences.chinese: 这个电影明星回避回答有关她私生活的问题。

sentences.english: When it comes to the private life of the presidents, there are many 19)juicy details to be revealed.
sentences.chinese: 说到总统们的私生活，有很多奇趣秘闻可以透露一下。

sentences.english: The magazine always reports extensively on the private lives of celebrities.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志经常大篇幅报道名人的私生活。

sentences.english: It is true that television programs concerning personal lives of celebrities always receive the highest audience rating.
sentences.chinese: 有关名人私生活的电视节目的确总能获得高收视率。

sentences.english: The is fascinated by the private lives of public figures.
sentences.chinese: 公宗对淑会名柳的私生活具友浓厚的兴趣。

sentences.english: Jack encroached on Mary's private life.
sentences.chinese: 杰克闯入了玛丽的私生活。

pinyin: luan4 gao3 nan2 nu:3 guan1 xi4

definition: to fall into bad company/to make acquaintances indiscriminately
clean-living and honest (idiom); to avoid immorality/to shun evil influence/to mind one's own business and keep out of trouble/to keep one's hands clean
to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
